contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the time when God will put his people back in the land of Israel. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
Here "knowledge" refers to the knowledge of God. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])

When people sinned, they would offer sacrifices so God would forgive them. The priests were allowed to eat these sacrifices. The priests eating these sacrifices for sin is spoken of as if they would actually feed on the people's sins. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: They feed on the sin of my people

contextId.occurrenceNote: The priests want the people to sin more so that the people will offer more sacrifices that the priests may eat. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they are greedy for more of their wickedness

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people are selling and buying products dishonestly. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
Jacob wanted to take his brother's place as the firstborn, so he tried to keep his brother from being born first. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: In the womb Jacob grasped his brother by the heel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jacob fought with an angel so that the angel would bless him. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: He struggled with the angel and won

contextId.occurrenceNote: Part of idol worship was kissing idol figures that were images of calves. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: These men who sacrifice kiss calves

contextId.occurrenceNote: This probably means words of confession and praise. Alternate translation: "Confess your sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
